reviews.review_msg: While lectures aren't mandatory they are almost necessary to assure your success in this course. Kanna is a knowledgeable and highly educated professor but VERY dry. It's hard to pay attention and follow along in lecture. That being said: attend every lecture and do the practice hw questions and you'll be golden.
Brace yourself for public humiliation when you present your group project. Kanna will grill your group in front of the whole class if you can't answer her questions.

Prof Kanna is so understanding and accommodating. I think it's the first time they're reaching HSCI341. It has been kinda tough but Prof Kanna has taken feedback from students and changed the course structure to better help the students and make sure we're not overburdened. The material

I enjoyed having Dr. Hayashi as a prof. Her lectures were organized, she gave practice questions and lectures to walk you through examples that came in handy for assignments and exams. Some assignment and exam questions did not necessarily have a right/wrong answer as long as you gave a meaningful explanation. The TA's were also very helpful.

Kanna is a kind professor. Her accent and way of teaching made it slightly hard for me to learn from her personally. The textbook is good at explaining stuff and I recommend it. I didn't watch her lectures and got 85% or more on everything leading up to the Final. The take-home final was hard but we had 4 days for it so can't really complain there.

She is the perfect prof for online courses. You don't need to watch/read the lectures or any of her provided course material. All you need to do is read the textbook pages she assigns which take like 45 mins/week and you are good. This is what I did along with some others and I'm pretty sure we're gonna get As. The final was a take-home exam too.

Do not take this course with Kanna. Her final exam is 30% and is ridiculously hard, nothing like her assignments, midterm or quizzes. Her quizzes were just for completion and she gives a practice midterm. However, the marking on her exam was brutal.

Honestly, it's not Dr. Hayashi's fault - epidemiology is boring. That being said, sometimes she doesn't communicate topics very well, and you'd best show up to her lectures simply because her lecture slides don't always give the full picture. Aside from this, though, she's very caring and passionate about her work. Glad I got to learn epi from her.

I'm glad I took this class with her simply because she went into such depth for her explanations. She reviews the previous weeks materials and tries to make it as understandable as possible. Though because of this lectures do become very long and dry. 2 assignments corresponding to the material we've learnt 20% each + a midterm and final 30% each.

While the material in the class can be difficult, especially because Kanna goes into very detailed explanations, if you attend class you will do fine. She outlines exactly what you need to do each week in order to stay up to date, if you follow these instructions and ask questions when you do not understand you will do fine.
She is not a bad professor, however, super boring plus extremely hard exams.  Just don't waste your time on it. NOT RECOMMENDED!
